attributes.action: Place trigger warnings on films for eating disorders and child loss
attributes.additional_details: Thousands of individuals worldwide are affected by eating disorders and child loss. Moreover, I understand that films have warnings for violence, sexual content and even self harm. However I believe that there is a gap here for supporting individuals that have been in traumatising situations and are not aware that the film's may contain these explicit depictions.
attributes.background: To kindly request that films/media have more trigger warnings in regards to depictions of individuals suffering with eating disorders/disordered eating and child loss.

rejection.details:
This would be the responsibility of the British Board of Film Classification. The BBFC is a non-governmental body and is independent of the UK Government and Parliament.

The BBFC carries out periodic consultations with the public about its classification system. You can find out more about its work here: https://www.bbfc.co.uk/.
